Problem:
Consider a signal processing system that filters an input signal x(t) using a transfer function H(s). We examine how impulse response h(t), which is the inverse Laplace Transform of H(s), affects the output y(t) of the system.

Assuming that we observe the system output y(T) at some time T, can we unequivocally infer the original input signal x_0(t) at t = 0 without knowledge of h(t)?
Explanation: Without knowing the impulse response h(t), it's impossible to work backward uniquely from y(T) to deduce x_0(t), as different input signals could produce the same output when convoluted with different impulse responses.
